N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 588.10 - Standards pertaining to reimbursement for intensive psychiatric rehabilitative treatment programs

State Regulations
(a) Intensive
psychiatric rehabilitation treatment visits shall be reimbursed on the basis of
duration of hours provided as follows: (1)

Reimbursement shall be provided for visits of at least one hour in duration and
not more than five hours per recipient per day. (2)

Reimbursement shall be provided for no
more than 72 hours per recipient per month. (3)

Reimbursement shall be provided for no
more than 720 hours per recipient per year. (b) The utilization review authority
designated pursuant to section
587.6
of this Title shall conduct
the following reviews regarding, at a minimum, a random 25 percent sample of
recipients: (1)
a review of the
appropriateness of admission to an intensive psychiatric rehabilitation
treatment program within 30 days after admission; (2)
a review of the need for continued
treatment in an intensive psychiatric rehabilitation treatment program within
four months after admission and every three months thereafter. (c) The determination of need for
admission to or continued treatment in an intensive psychiatric rehabilitation
treatment program shall be reviewable by the Office of Mental Health or its
designated agent. (d) The referring
licensed practitioner, in accordance with section
587.13
(b) of this

Title, or another licensed practitioner who is not affiliated with the
intensive psychiatric rehabilitation treatment program, shall review the need
for continued treatment four months after admission and quarterly thereafter. Such reviews shall be documented in the psychiatric rehabilitation service
plan. (e) The psychiatric
rehabilitation service plan required pursuant to section
587.17
of this Title shall be
completed within five visits after admission. Review of the service plan shall
be every month. Notes
